page.title: 12CHANGES SINCE 1955
page.content: Residents noted the improvement in housing, school facilities and amenities. They regretted the loss of small community atmosphere and open space caused by increasing urbanisation. Some felt that there had been an increase in vandalism and crime. There are few employment opportunities. The larger factories have closed or reduced their labour force. The newer industrial estates have not compensated for this loss of jobs. The area is traversed by major roads and the increase in traffic has caused problems particularly for the very young and the old. Although industrial pollution has been reduced, exhaust fumes etc., from cars, are a growing problem. The community has become increasingly cosmopolitan
